Hey Stranger

I’m Sean Durfee. I'm a designer. Sort of. I’m a designer but I'm also front-end developer and project manager who comes from a background in international relations. ... I don’t really know what I am. “Fusionist” sounds like a bad superhero name from the 60s and “creative” rubs me the wrong way. However you word it, I help people and businesses find humble solutions to complex problems. Sometimes that involves writing code, other times it’s a brand refresh, creating a product, or breathing new life into an old project. Sometimes it’s all of the above and other times it’s something completely new.

I keep busy

Product designer: Chilly Technologies ; fire extinguisher and designer: Vancouver Design Week; designer & developer: House House Design.

I like things

Typography, photography, food, and flying. Mountains, dogs, beaches, and bourbon. Coffee, coding, barbeque's, and books. Philosophy and sci-fi. Fitzgerald, Eco, Murakami, and Mitchell. Quiet moments in loud places.

I've worked with cool cats

Quander, Denim & Steel Interactive, Vancouver Design Week, The University of British Columbia, TRIBE, Great Dane Coffee, The Envoy, Friends Made, Commissary Connect.

Copyright ©2017, Sean Durfee – Give me a shout!

Colophon: This site was built by myself by hand in HTML and SCSS. Fonts are Freight Sans + Freight Text by Joshua Darden, and are served up with Adobe Typekit. Everything is compiled and served through Jekyll, hosted on Github Pages. Thanks for stopping by!
